storyTitle: As Attendance System Integrator, I want to connect biometric devices to the system to achieve real-time attendance data ingestion

testCases.title: Validate successful connection and data ingestion from biometric device
preconditions: Attendance system is running and accessible
Biometric device API is available and operational
Valid OAuth2 credentials are available for authentication
Network connectivity between system and biometric device is stable
Ingestion dashboard is accessible for monitoring
Test employee ID exists in the system database

steps.action: Navigate to the biometric device configuration page in the attendance system
steps.expectedResult: Configuration page loads successfully with fields for device connection settings

steps.action: Enter valid biometric device API endpoint URL in the configuration field
steps.expectedResult: API endpoint URL is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Enter valid OAuth2 client ID and client secret credentials
steps.expectedResult: Credentials are accepted and masked appropriately for security

steps.action: Click 'Test Connection' button to initiate authentication
steps.expectedResult: System establishes authenticated connection successfully and displays 'Connection Successful' message

steps.action: Save the biometric device configuration settings
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Simulate an attendance event from the biometric device with valid employee ID and current timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device sends attendance event to the system via API endpoint /api/attendance/ingest

steps.action: Monitor the system processing time from event receipt to completion
steps.expectedResult: System receives and processes the attendance event within 1 minute (60 seconds)

steps.action: Verify the attendance record appears in the system database
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record is created with correct employee ID, timestamp, and device source information

steps.action: Navigate to the ingestion logs dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Ingestion logs page loads successfully showing recent activities

steps.action: Search for the simulated attendance event in the ingestion logs
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged with 'SUCCESS' status, accurate timestamp, employee ID, and processing duration

postconditions: Biometric device remains connected and authenticated
Attendance event is successfully stored in the database
Ingestion log entry is created with success status
System is ready to receive additional attendance events
No error alerts are generated

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid attendance events
preconditions: Attendance system is running and accessible
Biometric device is connected and authenticated
Data validation rules are configured in the system
Error logging mechanism is enabled
Test access to error logs dashboard is available

steps.action: Prepare an attendance event payload with missing employee ID field but valid timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Test payload is ready with incomplete data structure

steps.action: Send the attendance event with missing employee ID to the system via /api/attendance/ingest endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System receives the event and initiates validation process

steps.action: Verify the API response status code and error message
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the event with HTTP 400 Bad Request status and returns error message 'Employee ID is required'

steps.action: Check that no attendance record was created in the database
steps.expectedResult: No attendance record exists for the invalid event

steps.action: Navigate to the error logs dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Error logs page loads successfully

steps.action: Search for the rejected event in error logs
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged with 'VALIDATION_ERROR' status, timestamp, and detailed error message 'Missing required field: employee_id'

steps.action: Prepare a second attendance event payload with valid employee ID but invalid timestamp format (e.g., 'invalid-date-format')
steps.expectedResult: Test payload is ready with incorrect timestamp format

steps.action: Send the attendance event with invalid timestamp format to the system
steps.expectedResult: System receives the event and initiates validation process

steps.action: Verify the API response status code and error message
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the event with HTTP 400 Bad Request status and returns error message 'Invalid timestamp format'

steps.action: Check that no attendance record was created in the database for this event
steps.expectedResult: No attendance record exists for the invalid timestamp event

steps.action: Review the error logs dashboard for all rejected events
steps.expectedResult: Both invalid events are recorded with detailed error messages including event payload, validation failure reason, timestamp of rejection, and device source

postconditions: No invalid attendance records are stored in the database
All validation errors are logged with detailed information
System continues to accept valid events normally
Error logs are available for integrator review
Data integrity is maintained

testCases.title: Test automatic retry on ingestion failure
preconditions: Attendance system is running and accessible
Biometric device is connected and authenticated
Automatic retry mechanism is enabled with 3 retry attempts configured
Network simulation tools are available to simulate failures
Alert notification system is configured
Access to system logs and monitoring dashboard is available

steps.action: Prepare a valid attendance event with correct employee ID and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Valid test event payload is ready for transmission

steps.action: Configure network simulation tool to block connectivity between biometric device and attendance system
steps.expectedResult: Network connectivity is temporarily blocked, simulating network failure

steps.action: Send the valid attendance event from biometric device to the system
steps.expectedResult: Event transmission fails due to network connectivity issue

steps.action: Monitor the system logs for automatic retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates first retry attempt within configured retry interval

steps.action: Verify the first retry attempt fails due to continued network blockage
steps.expectedResult: First retry attempt fails and is logged with 'RETRY_ATTEMPT_1' status

steps.action: Monitor for the second automatic retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates second retry attempt and logs 'RETRY_ATTEMPT_2' status

steps.action: Verify the second retry attempt fails
steps.expectedResult: Second retry attempt fails and is logged appropriately

steps.action: Monitor for the third automatic retry attempt
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates third and final retry attempt with 'RETRY_ATTEMPT_3' status logged

steps.action: Before the third retry completes, restore network connectivity by removing the network blockage
steps.expectedResult: Network connectivity is restored successfully between biometric device and system

steps.action: Verify the third retry attempt succeeds
steps.expectedResult: System successfully ingests the pending attendance event on the third retry attempt

steps.action: Check the attendance database for the event record
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record is created successfully with correct employee ID, timestamp, and ingestion metadata

steps.action: Review the ingestion logs for complete retry history
steps.expectedResult: Logs show all three retry attempts with timestamps and final 'SUCCESS' status after third attempt

steps.action: Check the alert notifications dashboard
steps.expectedResult: No alert notification is sent to the integrator since ingestion succeeded within the 3 retry attempts

steps.action: Verify system continues to process new events normally
steps.expectedResult: System is operational and ready to receive and process additional attendance events

postconditions: Attendance event is successfully ingested after retry
Complete retry history is logged with all attempts documented
No alert is generated since ingestion succeeded within retry limit
Network connectivity is restored to normal state
System continues normal operation without manual intervention
Data integrity is maintained with no data loss
